Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 5064a25bc6d64424d716652c10f4fce953e0991a

minor changes needed.  can’t approve until there’s a patchset that actually implements the correct behavior for heartbeat.  checking in a patch that only supports Get/post/patch doesn’t accomplish the goal.
why int16 here?  if we want to limit to a value, just limit the value, don’t set a non json type.
Changed to uint64_t
remove conditional.  the properties should always be populated.
Done
return?
Done
return?
Done
this is not a query parameter.

Right, it should be `propertyValueOutOfRange`.
Fixed
to string isn’t correct here.  should load directly.

It should be `propertyValueOutOfRange`. (BTW, for `queryParameterOutOfRange`, its args are `string_view` - https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/a91e0057b56edf05b153b0e5f9bab8e0eecf99f2/redfish-core/src/error_messages.cpp#L1800)

Yep, queryParameterOutOfRange takes strings because all query params are strings.

propertyValueOutOfRange takes json objects, because it's the correct error to use here.
Done
remove.  properties should not be present or not present dependent on their value.  otherwise PATCH semantics are wrong:

Spec tells that 
1) `HeartbeatIntervalMinutes` should be between 1-65535.
(https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/a91e0057b56edf05b153b0e5f9bab8e0eecf99f2/redfish-core/schema/dmtf/json-schema/EventDestination.v1_15_0.json#L222C1-L226C34)


If the fields should always be shown, what should be the default value of `HeartbeatIntervalMinutes`?
If it is set to 0 (current), it will cause Redfish Service Validator failures like
```
1 err.Edm.Int64 errors in /redfish/v1/EventService/Subscriptions/708345159
1 failProp errors in /redfish/v1/EventService/Subscriptions/708345159
ERROR - HeartbeatIntervalMinutes: Value out of assigned min range, 0 > 1
```

2) One way to avoid the above issues, I think we can hide the values if `SendHeartbeat` is false, as the spec tells https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/a91e0057b56edf05b153b0e5f9bab8e0eecf99f2/redfish-core/schema/dmtf/json-schema/EventDestination.v1_15_0.json#L356

```
  "SendHeartbeat": {
      "longDescription": .... If this property is not present, no periodic event shall be sent. ....,
```

3) Or, should we set the default value of `HeartbeatIntervalMinutes` as max value - 65535 as a default (with sendHeartbeat == false)?

----

At this time, I'm going to choose (3) - set the default value of HeartbeatIntervalMinutes to the max (65535).

So there are 2 properties here: 
"HeartbeatIntervalMinutes" 
and 
"SendHeartbeat" 
right? 

And "SendHeartbeat" has to be true for the Heartbeat to be sent? 
So the discussion here is what should the default of HeartbeatIntervalMinutes be?
Most clients, if they set SendHeartbeat, I assume, would also set HeartbeatIntervalMinutes.
Something like 65535 is fine but I think a reasonable best guess use case like 10 mins is also fine.

Right.
`HeartbeatIntervalMinutes` is used when `SendHeartbeat` is true.
In this case, one way to force is to require `HeartbeatIntervalMinutes` on PATCH or POST if `SendHeartbeat` is true.  Or, use the previously set interval (or 10 minutes by default).

--

If `SendHeartbeat` is false, `HeartbeatInervalMinutes` will still show. Would it be okay to show `HeartbeatInervalMinutes=10 && SendHeartbeat=false` by default?

I think we want to show SendHeartbeat and HeartbeatInervalMinutes all the time in the GET since I think we want those properties to be able to be PATCHed at any time. 

Redfish explained for another discussion as, if you are plumber you want to be able to adjust the pipes (HeartbeatInervalMinutes in this case) without turning on the water (SendHeartbeat in this case). 

If these properties aren't included in the POST to create the subscription they would have the default values (SendHeartbeat = false and HeartbeatIntervalMinutes  = xxx) 

I am okay with xxx being 65535 but also okay with xxx being something more realistic like 10.

Thanks for explanation.
As I would agree, I set 10 as a default.
Done
You could add a comment that 10 is just a reasonable default value and most clients will update if they turn  sendHeartbeat  on
Done
include optional
Done
Done
Still can't merge until there's an implementation of this that functions as the spec specifies.
I've given a week for the patchset containing the actual functionality to appear;  Moving to WIP so this falls off the to-review list.
I submitted a heartbeat logic - https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/75791

> I submitted a heartbeat logic - https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/75791

Good.  We can merge them together.
would -> will
remove "the"
Done
Done
Why does this condition exist at all?  SSE subscriptions aren't persisted?

DMTF explicitly specifies that Heartbeat does not apply for SSE

https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/5fe4ef35821f946c91d9c20cee01e632d6d3ffd4/redfish-core/schema/dmtf/json-schema/EventDestination.v1_15_0.json#L358

```
"SendHeartbeat": {
....
This property shall not apply to event destinations if the `SubscriptionType` property contains the value `SSE`.",
```
Right, but how would sendHeartbeat ever be enabled for SSE?  Asked another way, how can I cause the code to hit this branch?

Agreed. SSE subscriptionType can't be set here.
Removed the condition.
Done
This is an internal file being restored.  We should restore the values as is.  They've already had limits applied.

This is reading from persistent file.
Isn't it still a proper to validate the content like what's done for `DeliveryRetryAttempts` or `DeliveryRetryIntervalSeconds`?

https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/blob/5fe4ef35821f946c91d9c20cee01e632d6d3ffd4/include/event_service_store.hpp#L289
Not when it duplicates code and causes a failure to read in.
Yes, it is duplicated with L114.  Removed the condition.
Done
Please make this explicitly 65535, and note that it came from the redfish schema limits.
Done
And I assume the post also works?
including it in the post also works?
Added POST example in commit message
I don't think you need this anymore
It was missed when `DeliveryRetryAttempts` and `DeliveryRetryIntervalSeconds` were added, and it is needed.
same here don't think you need this anymore
Right. Removed

This confused me, this is actually the Post. 
Oh well, beyond this review. 
Makes sense, you can set it either on the Post or the Patch
It would be helpful to add a link to the schema that defines these properties.
Added the schema links
Should this confirm *value is also > 0?
Good catch. I've updated it
yeah, I guess that catches 0
Looks like we changed this back from std::numeric_limits?
Right. I've changed it as you suggested - https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/75516/comment/df9ce315_baa97452/
ack.
I realize you're trying to format this reasonably, but it's not clear that what's here is actually better.  Can you please remove these //
Removed
Probably correct, but seems unrelated to this patch.  I'm not worried about it, but we should call it out.
Removed this unrelated change
Feel free to fix this in a separate commit (doesn't have to be part of this stack but can if easier)
